page.title: 12FITZROY ST. STATION : HULL
page.content: Less than 100 metres from the busy Beverley road and long forgotten by the people of Hull,stands the main passenger station of The Hull and Barnsley Railway Company. It is now over 60 years since the last train stopped here and now young trees grow up the drainpipes and weeds sprout from the cracks in the brickwork.It was in a hole in the wall that we found a nest built by a pair of wrens.An old man told us that a pair of barn owls used to roost in the rafters before vandals had driven them away by throwing stones.On a summers evening bats can be seen flitting in and out of the shattered windows. Next month however,the demolition men will move in and yet another old building will disappear for ever.
